BULLETIN NO. 138 
RELEASE OF LATEST ISSUE JIG STANDARDS 
16/09/2021 
 
JIG 1 - Aviation Fuel Quality Control & Operating Standards for Into-Plane Fuelling Services (Issue 13) 
JIG 2 - Aviation Fuel Quality Control & Operating Standards for Airport Depots & Hydrants (Issue 13) 
JIG 4 - Aviation Fuel Quality Control & Operating Standards for Smaller Airports (Issue 4) 
JIG Health, Safety, Security and Environmental Management System for Aviation Fuel Facilities (Issue 3) 
The latest issues of all JIG Standards have now been published, and we are delighted to announce that in addition 
to EI/JIG 1530 2nd Edition (May 2019), copies of JIG Standards 1, 2, 4 and the JIG HSSEMS are available to purchase 
online via the Standards & Publications area of the website www.jig.org from today, 16 September 2021. 
The Standards are available as downloadable PDF documents, or for delivery as A5-size hard copies. All copy types 
are priced to the public at PS275 per copy for JIG 1&2 and PS170 for JIG 4 but we are pleased to confirm that the 
Member price will be PS110 per copy for JIG 1&2 and PS65 for JIG 4, with discounts available for bulk orders / mixed 
hard copy/PDF orders. Enquiries for bulk or mixed hard copy/PDF orders should be made to standards@jig.org. 
The JIG HSSE MS Standard is free of charge to JIG Members as a PDF and for PS5 as a hard copy and priced at PS25

for the general public. All prices will be reviewed on 1 January 2022. 
Operating to JIG Standards 
Locations operating to JIG Standards will continue to be inspected to JIG 1&2 Issue 12 and JIG 4 Issue 3 until 31 
December 2021. 
From 1 January 2022, locations operating to JIG Standards will be inspected to the latest Issues, with non-
compliances recorded as comments. Locations shall comply with the latest Issue requirements in their entirety 
before 1 January 2023. 
The new requirements of the JIG HSSEMS Standard - Issue 3, will take effect on 1 January 2023. A new audit 
checklist template will be published 1 January 2022. During 2022 only, participating locations/companies may 
choose to have their audit conducted against either the existing or new checklist. 
In addition to the release of the revised Standards, the following documents will be available: 
Summary of Changes 
A separate document (Summary of Changes), detailing where the changes have been made from the previous 
issues, will be available to download free of charge, to all purchasers of the revised Standards by contacting 
standards@jig.org. 
JIG HSSE Management System Standard 
The updated JIG HSSE Management System

will be available to download free of charge, to all purchasers of the revised Standards by contacting 
standards@jig.org. 
JIG HSSE Management System Standard 
The updated JIG HSSE Management System Standard accompanying documents will be available via the JIG 
website to JIG Members including: 
JIG HSSEMS External Audit Terms of Reference 
JIG HSSEMS Audit Report Template 
JIG HSSEMS Gap Analysis Tool 
Translated Standards 
JIG will be commissioning the translation of the Standards into several languages in 2022 and will keep Members 
informed on their availability.

All hydrant systems shall be equipped with dual air lanyard pilots, and where not fitted, a dual 
air lanyard system shall be retrofitted to all existing hydrant systems no later than 31 
December 2024* 
* JIG is examining the issue of testing the refuelling vehicle Deadman independently when connected to a dual air/lanyard pilot 
valve. Test rig operators may retain existing lanyard only operated hydrant pit valves until this review is completed. 
The latest issues of JIG 1,2 and 4 also contain a number of extra requirements for equipment introduced into 
service or modified from 1 January 2023. These requirements can be found in the Standard or in the Summary of 
Changes document.
